intro: Chengiopanax fargesii, commonly known as the Yunnan ginseng tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, with its roots and stems used in traditional Chinese medicine. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered an endangered species.
